column3: str
Sorocan gazes into the distance, a concerned frown upon her face.
Deliver the Oroniri leather bag to Khaidai.
Survey the area for desertmaker beetles and use the vials of acid to slay any that appear.
Speak with Khaidai.
Report to Sorocan.
If your attire is anything to go by, you must be the traveler I have heard so much about. I am glad our paths have crossed.

Earlier, my husband left to take some of our sheep to the grazing fields, and in his haste, forgot his medicine bag. I fear without it, he may not be able to contend with the dangerous pests that roam there.
Please, see that it reaches him quickly. You should be able to find him to the south of here, tending to a flock of sheep.
I only hope it is not too late. Please hurry, for the grazing lands are often filled with danger.
Who are you and what have you come here for?
Sorocan sent you to deliver this to me? Unfortunately, you came too late.
You see, desertmaker beetles run rampant in this area. This bag contains a few vials of acid, which softens their tough carapace and renders them defenseless.
The creatures are incredibly tenacious and are difficult to take down without the help of this mixture. Earlier, I attempted to drive one off on my own and was injured.
While I remain here to recover, would you go and clear the surrounding area of these beetles for me?
Here, take these vials. Empty their contents upon any desertmaker beetle that comes at you. It will make them that much easier to kill.
Please see that the neighboring areas are cleared of any stray desertmaker beetles. In the meantime, I shall remain here and gather my strength.
The beetles are gone, I take it? Now finally my sheep can graze in peace and I need not fear facing another one under less-than-favorable circumstances. Thank you.

In addition to being organized, my wife has a knack for picking out reliable individuals. I cannot count the number of times I have been saved by that woman. I do not know what I would do without her...
B-But don't you ever tell her that I said that! As an Oroniri man, it is my duty to protect her, not the other way around.
Now then, if you want your reward, you best return to my wife. She will see that you are fairly compensated for your services.
Oh! You are back! My husband was not hurt, was he?
Bahaha! Perhaps now he has finally learned his lesson!
<sigh> Then again, I suppose I cannot complain. While Khaidai may not have the eye for detail that I do, he is an incredibly kind man and does what he can to take care of both me and our sheep.
Ah─but forgive me. You have not come all this way to hear me talk about my husband! Please, take this and feel free to be on your way!
